task.title: Edit the Publishing Template to add the CSS file

step.cmd: Unzip the ZIP archive associated with the WebHelp Publishing Template in a separate folder. Skip this step if your publishing template is already stored in a folder.
Link the folder associated with the publishing Template in the Project view.
step.stepresult: You should have the template root folder linked in your project, custom_footer_template for instance.

step.cmd: Using the project view, copy your custom CSS in a inner folder within publishing template root folder, in the custom_footer_template/resources folder for instance.
step.stepresult: You should have the custom_footer_template/resources/wh_footer.css file in your publishing package root folder.

step.cmd: Open the publishing template descriptor in editor to edit. You will benefit by the content completion and validation support.
Add the new CSS in the descriptor resources section. This will instruct the transformation to link the wh_footer.css in all generated HTML files.
You can archive the folder as ZIP to be easier to store or share with others. It is optional because a publishing template can be also stored in a folder.
